IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDES COMPREHENSIVE EDUCATIONAL AND THERAPEUTIC SERVICES TO CHILDREN WITH AND WITHOUT SPECIAL NEEDS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: PROVIDES COMPREHENSIVE EDUCATIONAL AND THERAPEUTIC SERVICES TO CHILDREN WITH AND WITHOUT SPECIAL NEEDS.
IRS990.Desc: EACH YEAR MEETING STREET SERVES OVER 4,000 CHILDREN OF ALL ABILITIES IN A VARIETY OF INCLUSIVE SETTINGS. OUR EARLY CHILDHOOD SERVICES TEAM WORKS WITH CHILDREN FROM PRENATAL TO KINDERGARTEN ACROSS A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS, INCLUDING EARLY HEAD START (PROGRAM SUPPORTS PARENTS' EFFORTS TO FULFILL THEIR PARENTAL ROLES AND MOVE FAMILIES TOWARD SELF-SUFFICIENCY; SERVES CHILDREN BIRTH TO AGE THREE AND THEIR FAMILIES IN PROVIDENCE); EARLY INTERVENTION (SERVICES FOR CHILDREN BIRTH TO AGE THREE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DELAYS OR DISABILITIES); EARLY LEARNING CENTER (NATIONALLY ACCREDITED CENTER FOR CHILDREN OF ALL ABILITIES AGE SIX WEEKS THROUGH PRE-KINDERGARTEN); HEALTHY FAMILIES AMERICA (NATIONAL EVIDENCE-BASED MATERNAL AND CHILD HOME VISITING PROGRAM THAT PAIRS EXPECTANT MOTHERS OR FAMILIES WITH NEWBORNS WITH A FAMILY SUPPORT WORKER); PROVIDENCE TALKS (LITERACY DEVELOPMENT HOME VISITING PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN IN PROVIDENCE BIRTH TO AGE THREE); STATE PRE-K (STATE FUNDED PROGRAM PROVIDING FREE, HIGH QUALITY PRE-KINDERGARTEN CLASSES; AND WIC (PROGRAM OFFERS NUTRITION ADVICE AND PROVIDES CHECKS FOR HEALTHY FOOD TO QUALIFYING FAMILIES). OUR SCHOOL AGE SERVICES TEAM SERVES CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS FROM KINDERGARTEN TO AGE TWENTY TWO ACROSS TWO PROGRAMS. THE GRACE SCHOOL (K-8) IS OUR INCLUSIVE SCHOOL PROVIDING RIGOROUS ACADEMICS AND INDIVIDUALIZED INSTRUCTION FOR STUDENTS WITH AND WITHOUT DISABILITIES. THE CARTER SCHOOL (MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL) SUPPORTS EDUCATION, VOCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AND RECREATIONAL AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES TAILORED TO EACH STUDENT'S SPECIFIC INTERESTS AND ABILITIES.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: BLUE CROSS & BLUE SHIELD OF RI

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT INCLUDES BOTH DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND A FUND DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD TO FUNCTION AS AN ENDOWMENT. THE BOARD HAS ADOPTED INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES AND SPENDING POLICIES TO ATTEMPT TO PROVIDE A PREDICTABLE STREAM OF FUNDING TO SUPPORT PROGRAMS AND MAJOR CAPITAL EXPENDITURES, WHILE ENHANCING THE PURCHASING POWER OF THE PORTFOLIO. TO SATISFY ITS LONG-TERM RATE-OF-RETURN OBJECTIVES, THE ORGANIZATION TARGETS A DIVERSIFIED ASSET ALLOCATION THAT PLACES A GREATER EMPHASIS ON EQUITY-BASED INVESTMENTS TO ACHIEVE ITS LONG-TERM RETURN OBJECTIVES WITH PRUDENT RISK CONSTRAINTS. MEETING STREET HAS A POLICY OF ANNUALLY WITHDRAWING, FOR OPERATING PURPOSES, NO MORE THAN 5% OF THE AVERAGE MARKET VALUE OF THE INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO, CALCULATED ANNUALLY ON AUGUST 31 USING AN AVERAGE OF QUARTERLY MARKET VALUES FOR THE PRIOR THREE YEARS. DURING THE YEAR ENDED AUGUST 31, 2018, APPROXIMATELY $320,000 WAS WITHDRAWN IN ACCORDANCE WITH ITS POLICY.

MEETING STREET QUALIFIES AS A TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE "IRC"). AS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITY, THE ORGANIZATION IS SUBJECT TO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX ("UBIT"), IF APPLICABLE. IN ACCORDANCE WITH FASB ASC 740, INCOME TAXES, THE ORGANIZATION APPLIES THE "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" THRESHOLD TO THE RECOGNITION AND DERECOGNITION OF TAX POSITIONS FOR ITS CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX POSITIONS AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT THERE WERE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT QUALIFIED FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THESE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES, WHICH IS CHARGED WITH THE ANNUAL PERFORMANCE APPRAISAL OF THE PRESIDENT AND WITH ESTABLISHING COMPENSATION FOR SAID OFFICER, HAS HISTORICALLY PROVIDED FOR ANNUAL PAYMENTS FOR SUPPLEMENTAL RETIREMENT PURPOSES WHICH ARE GROSSED-UP TO NET THE PRESIDENT PAYMENTS OF $7,000 AND $5,000.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: SISTER OF JOHN M. KELLY, PRESIDENT OF THE ORGANIZATION
BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: MARGARET KNOWLTON IS THE DIRECTOR OF SCHOOL-AGE PROGRAMS FOR THE ORGANIZATION. HER HIRING WAS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND SHE REPORTS TO THE CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER OF THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE FINANCE/AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES BEFORE FILING. A COPY OF THE 990 IS ALSO PROVIDED TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH TRUSTEE AND STAFF MEMBER MUST SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST ACKNOWLEDGEMENT UPON COMMENCEMENT OF ASSOCIATION OR EMPLOYMENT. TRUSTEES: ANY TRUSTEE WHO MAY BE INVOLVED IN A MEETING STREET BUSINESS TRANSACTION IN WHICH THERE IS A POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST SHALL PROMPTLY NOTIFY THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE TRUSTEE WILL REFRAIN FROM VOTING ON SUCH MATTER AND THE TRUSTEE, OR THE CHAIR IN THE TRUSTEE'S ABSENCE, WILL DISCLOSE THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST TO THE OTHER BOARD MEMBERS BEFORE THE VOTE TAKES PLACE AND SUCH DISCLOSURES SHALL BE RECORDED IN THE BOARD MINUTES. ANY TRANSACTION INVOLVING A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST SHALL HAVE TERMS THAT ARE FAIR AND REASONABLE AS THOUGH MEETING STREET WERE DEALING WITH AN UNRELATED PARTY. STAFF: ALL STAFF MEMBERS ARE TO DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST TO THE DIRECTOR OF HUMAN RESOURCES. ALL REPORTS OF POTENTIAL CONFLICTS WILL BE FORWARDED TO THE PRESIDENT. THE PRESIDENT SHALL TAKE SUCH ACTION AS IS NECESSARY TO ENSURE THE TRANSACTION IS COMPLETED IN THE BEST INTEREST OF MEETING STREET.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HIRES AN INDEPENDENT HUMAN RESOURCE CONSULTING FIRM TO CONDUCT AN ASSESSMENT OF COMPENSATION, DETERMINED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE FIRM NOT ONLY PERFORMS A COMPREHENSIVE COMPARABILITY STUDY, BUT ALSO EMPLOYS A SERIES OF COMPENSATION REVIEW PRACTICES THAT ARE INCLUDED IN THE EXCESS BENEFIT TRANSACTION RULES OF SECTION 4958 OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. COMPENSATION REVIEWS ARE NOT ONLY DONE FOR THE PRESIDENT, BUT ARE ALSO DONE FOR KEY MANAGEMENT POSITIONS. THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. COMPENSATION DATA RECEIVED FOR KEY MANAGERS IS SHARED WITH THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE PRESIDENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR TOP MANAGEMENT POSITIONS AND WILL CONSULT WITH THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REGARDING ADDITIONAL MATERIAL COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PUBLIC CAN OBTAIN A COPY OF THE FORM 990 UPON REQUEST TO THE ORGANIZATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PUBLIC CAN OBTAIN DOCUMENTATION UPON REQUEST.
THE PROCESS OF REVIEW HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
